metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6327 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
drivers/infiniband/ulp/srpt/ib_srpt.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5.1allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereferenceand system crash) by using an ABORT_TASK command to abort a device writeoperation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-86.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
